channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-8780] A column Family can have VERSIONS less than zero
item.description:
User can create/alter a columnfam and set its VERSION(aka maxVERSIONS) to a negative or zero value. Although there is a checking in HColumnDesciptor#construtor, hbase shell command will invoke the setter(setMaxVersions and setMinVersions) directly, hence by pass the checking. For example:

set VERSIONS = -1

hbase(main):016:0> create 't5_dn',{NAME=>'cf1',VERSIONS=>-1}

0 row(s) in 1.0420 seconds



hbase(main):017:0> put 't5_dn','row1','cf1:q1','row1cf1_v1'

0 row(s) in 0.0700 seconds



hbase(main):018:0> scan 't5_dn'

ROW                   COLUMN+CELL                                              

0 row(s) in 0.0090 seconds



hbase(main):019:0> describe 't5_dn'

DESCRIPTION                                          ENABLED                    

't5_dn', {NAME => 'cf1', REPLICATION_SCOPE => '0',  true                      

KEEP_DELETED_CELLS => 'false', COMPRESSION => 'NONE                            

', ENCODE_ON_DISK => 'true', BLOCKCACHE => 'true',                            

MIN_VERSIONS => '0', DATA_BLOCK_ENCODING => 'NONE',                            

 IN_MEMORY => 'false', BLOOMFILTER => 'NONE', TTL =                            

> '2147483647', VERSIONS => '-1', BLOCKSIZE => '655                            

36'}                                                                          

1 row(s) in 0.0410 seconds

above example shows VERSIONS => '-1', and put/scan doesn't keep the data
item.summary: A column Family can have VERSIONS less than zero

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
the fix moves the error checking from constructor to the setters with minor twist.

Fix is built and tested against 94.8. Thanks for reviewing this.
Looks good.. Can u attach a patch for Trunk? Then we can run HadoopQA
Anoop, many thanks for reviewing. I am currently out of office, and don't have access to build a new patch. I will get to it a bit later.
upload trunk patch

Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

sorry for the delay. I am just back and begin to look into this problem. today I run the test against trunk, but can't recreate the reported failures:

Demai

This message is automatically generated.

The tests failed because of the following change in setMinVersions():


+      if (minVersions >= this.getMaxVersions()) {

+        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Minimum versions must be < " + "maximum versions "

+            + this.getMaxVersions());

+      }

setMaxVersions() and setMinVersions() may be called in the following order:


      htd.addFamily(new HColumnDescriptor(cfName)

          .setMinVersions(minVersions)

          .setMaxVersions(versions)

where minVersions would momentarily be greater than cached maxVersions.

One solution is to introduce setMinMaxVersions(int, int) where the comparison between maxVersions and minVersions can be performed accurately.

Ted,

thanks a lot. I was thinking about this scenario, thought the order, which setMaxVersions() first, inside HColumnDescriptor() covered this. Clearly, I was wrong.

if introducing setMinMaxVersions(int, int), but not to replace setMinVersion() and setMaxVersion(), will it works? the user can still use setMinVersions first as the testcase coded.

will always set a default value in HColumnDescriptor(cfName)work better?

Anyway, many thanks for the help. Let me think a bit more on this.

Demai

Maybe keep the original checks in HColumnDescriptor ctor and add the following check:


   public HColumnDescriptor setMaxVersions(int maxVersions) {

+    if (maxVersions <= 0) {

Ted, thanks for the suggestion. If keep the original checks in HColumnDescriptor ctor, when user invoke setMinVersions() or setMaxVersions(), the relationship(max>=min) won't be enforced. Let me give it one more try by add this to setMinVersions()


+      if (this.getMaxVersions() == 0) {

+        // only for the first time of initialization

+        // setMinVersion() while maxVersion has not been set yet

+        // setMaxVersion to Default to avoid throw errors

+        this.setMaxVersions(DEFAULT_VERSIONS);

+      }

if still won't pass QA, I will follow your suggestion by just checking maxVersions <=0
a revised version.

Thanks for the patch, Demai.

Thanks for the reviews, Chunhui and Anoop.
Ted, thanks a lot

This issue was closed as part of a bulk closing operation on 2015-11-20. All issues that have been resolved and where all fixVersions have been released have been closed (following discussions on the mailing list).
